did.abstract: This collection contains circulars, fliers, leaflets, newsletters, and other ephemera accumulated by Leonard Sklar, documenting a broad range of progressive/left politics in the 1980s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Kathryn Kish Sklar in 2009. The accession number associated with this gift is 2009.068.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed ephemera (circulars, fliers, leaflets, newsletters, etc.) accumulated by Leonard Sklar, documenting a broad range of progressive/left politics in the 1980s, including animal rights, economic and social justice, electoral politics (including the 1988 campaign of Jesse Jackson to become the Democratic Party Presidential candidate) environmentalism, peace movements and international solidarity (Central America, Iran), radical political parties, etc.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in circa 1980-1990, are expected to enter the public domain in 2110.
